intro: Heterorachis, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a unique species within the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems that twist and turn along the ground, creating an unusual growth pattern. The plant typically features small, narrow leaves arranged alternately along the stems. It produces clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers, which are often borne in dense inflorescences. Heterorachis is native to tropical regions and thrives in moist, shaded environments.
